definitions.definition: To move (one object) while maintaining contact with another object over some area, with pressure and friction.
definitions.example: I rubbed my hands together for warmth.

definitions.definition: To rub something against (a second thing).
definitions.example: I rubbed the glass with the cloth.
My shoes are beginning to rub.

definitions.definition: To spread a substance thinly over; to smear.
definitions.example: meat rubbed with spices before barbecuing

definitions.definition: To move or pass with difficulty.
definitions.example: to rub through woods, as huntsmen

definitions.definition: To scour; to burnish; to polish; to brighten; to cleanse; often with up or over.
To hinder; to cross; to thwart.
(bowls) To touch the jack with the bowl.
Having had a substance applied through rubbing.
